title: Processes - Area of Region - Function of x

content.question: What is the area of the region enclosed by the curve <math alttext="y equals the fraction 2 over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, and the lines <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the natural log of 4, minus the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>
<math alttext="2 times the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 times the natural log of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x
